description.narrative: To prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness in Indonesia.

condition.narrative: DLR Verification Arrangements (one month after effectiveness). Schedule 2, Section I.B.1 of the Loan AgreementBy no later than onemonth after the Effectiveness Date, the Borrower shall appoint BPKP to act as an independent verification agent to undertake theDLR verification process in respect of all DLRs for the Program.

Program Action Plan. (Continuous). Schedule 2, Section I.B.2 of the AF Loan AgreementWithout limitation on the generality ofSection I.A of this Schedule, the Borrower, through the MOH, shall except as the Bank and the Borrower shall otherwise agree inwriting, not assign, amend, abrogate, or waive, or permit to be assigned, amended, abrogated, or waived, the Program Action Plan,or any provision thereof.

Program Action Plan. (Continuous). Schedule 2, Section I.B.3 of the AF Loan AgreementWithout limitation on the generality ofSection I.A of this Schedule, the Borrower, through MOH, shall maintain policies and procedures adequate to enable it to monitorand evaluate, in accordance with guidelines acceptable to the Bank, the implementation of the Program Action Plan.

Program Action Plan. Schedule 2, Section I.B.1 of the AF Loan AgreementWithout limitation on the generality of Section I.A of thisSchedule, the Borrower, through the MOH, shall undertake the actions set forth in the Program Action Plan in a manner satisfactoryto the Bank.

Program Action Plan. Schedule 2, Section I.C.1 of the Loan AgreementThe Borrower shall undertake the actions set forth in theProgram Action Plan and maintain adequate policies/procedures to monitor and evaluate its implementation, in a manner satisfactoryto the Bank.

Program Implementation and Institutions. Schedule 2, Section I.A.1 of the AF Loan AgreementThe Borrower, through MOH, shall carryout the Program in conformity with appropriate administrative, technical, financial, economic, environmental and social, and publichealth standards and practices, including best practices in public vaccination.

Program Institutions. (Continuous) Schedule 2, Section I.A.1.(a) of the Loan AgreementThe Borrower shall maintain at all timesduring Program implementation a Program Steering Committee with a mandate, composition, staffing and resources satisfactory to theBank.

Program Institutions. (Continuous) Schedule 2, Section I.A.1.(b) of the Loan AgreementThe Borrower shall maintain at all timesduring Program implementation a Technical Committee with a mandate, composition, staffing and resources satisfactory to the Bank.

Program Institutions. (Continuous) Schedule 2, Section I.A.2 of the Loan AgreementThe Borrower shall ensure that the National TaskForce to Accelerate the Response to the COVID-19 Emergency is maintained throughout the COVID-19 emergency period, with MOHparticipating regularly in its sessions and serving as its Vice-Chair.

Sch2, Sect I.E.1 In the carrying out of Program activities, all of which are financed out of MOH's budget, relevant subunits of theNational Armed Forces and National Police under the Program shall be under the coordination of MOH and undertaken exclusively forpurposes related to the Program and strictly in accordance with Tech Guidelines and protocols developed under PAP and otherarrangement.

Sch2, Sect I.E.2 In the carrying out of Program activities, all of which are financed out of MOH's budget, and except as the Bankmay otherwise agree, the Borrower shall ensure that ownership of any assets generated, goods procured, and works constructed byrelevant subunits of the National Armed Forces and National Police out of the Loan proceeds shall be transferred to, or shall vest,with MOH.

Use of Military and Security Actors. (Continuous). Schedule 2, Section I.D.2 of the AF Loan Agreement.In the carrying out ofProgram activities, all of which are financed out of MOH's budget, and except as the Bank may otherwise agree, the Borrower shallensure that the ownership of any assets generated, goods procured, and works constructed by relevant sub-units of the NationalArmed Forces and the National Police out of the Loan proceeds shall be transferred to, or shall vest, with MOH.

Use of Military and Security Actors. Schedule 2, Section I.D.1 of the AF Loan Agreement. In the carrying out of Program activities,all of which are financed out of MOH's budget, the relevant sub-units of the National Armed Forces and/or the National Police underthe Program shall be under the coordination of MOH. Any said activities shall be undertaken exclusively for the purposes related tothe Program and strictly in accordance with the Technical Guidelines and protocols developed under the Program Action Plan, andother arrangements or protocols that the Bank may require for carrying out these activities.

Vaccine Delivery and Distribution. (Continuous) Schedule 2, Section I.C.2 of the AF Loan Agreement. The Borrower, through MOH,shall carry out the Program in accordance with this Agreement and the Technical Guidelines. In the event of any conflict betweenthe provisions of the Technical Guidelines and this Agreement, the provisions of this Agreement shall prevail.

Vaccine Delivery and Distribution. (Continuous). Schedule 2, Section I.D.2 of the Amended Loan Agreement The Borrower, throughMOH, shall maintain, for the duration of the Program, Technical Guidelines for COVID-19 vaccine delivery and distribution, in formand substance satisfactory to the Bank.

Vaccine Delivery and Distribution. (Continuous). Schedule 2, Section I.D.3 of the Amended Loan Agreement The Borrower, throughMOH, shall carry out the Program in accordance with this Agreement and the Technical Guidelines. In the event of any conflictbetween the provisions of the Technical Guidelines and this Agreement, the provisions of this Agreement shall prevail

Vaccine Delivery and Distribution. Schedule 2, Section I.C.1 of the AF Loan AgreementThe Borrower, through MOH, shall maintain,for the duration of the Program, Technical Guidelines for COVID-19 vaccine delivery and distribution, in form and substancesatisfactory to the Bank, which shall include: (a) rules and procedures for prioritizing intra-country vaccine allocationfollowing principles established in the WHO Fair Allocation Framework, including an action plan setting out the timeline and stepsfor implementing such rules; (b) rules and procedures establishing minimum standards for vaccine management and monitoring,including medical and technical criteria, communications and outreach plan, cold chain infrastructure, and other related logisticsinfrastructure; (c) principles and guidance for processing and collection of Personal Data in accordance with the Program ActionPlan; and(d) vaccine distribution plan, including action plan setting out timeline and steps for immunization.

Vaccine Delivery and Distribution. Schedule 2, Section I.D.1 of the Amended Loan AgreementThe Borrower, through MOH, shall carryout the Program in conformity with appropriate administrative, technical, financial, economic, environmental and social, and publichealth standards and practices, including best practices in public vaccination.

title.narrative: Cumulative number of website visitors to the COVID-19 communication portal set up by the Government of Indonesia
Number of times MOH counters COVID-19 related misinformation and posts on its website
Number of COVID-19 cases successfully treated, disaggregated by sex
MOH supports the creation of a multi-sectoral coordination mechanism for COVID-19 response

baseline.value: A multi-sectoral coordination mechanism for COVID-19 response does not exist

target.value: The multi-sectoral coordination mechanism for COVID-19 response is functional.

actual.value: The multi-sectoral coordination mechanism for COVID-19 response is functional

title.narrative: Infection prevention and clinical management protocols developed and disseminated to all non-referral facilities

baseline.value: Infection prevention and clinical management protocols not developed

target.value: Infection prevention and clinical management protocols developed and disseminated to all non-referral facilities

actual.value: MoH has issued the 5th revision of Guidelines for COVID-19 Prevention and Control, which contains guiding information on servicesand treatment of cases, among others

title.narrative: MOH supports the creation of a multi-sectoral coordination mechanism for COVID-19 response
Number of simulation exercises undertaken as per updated national pandemic preparedness plan
Enhanced community engagement and communication (as measured by the number of interactions with the COVID-19 phone line)
Reduced service readiness gap in treating severe respiratory illness patients (as measured by the available number of intensive care beds equipped as per national protocol)
Number of beds temporarily converted for patient isolation and/or low intensity medical care
Number of beds temporarily converted for patient isolation and/or low intensity medical care
Number of COVID-19 cases successfully treated, disaggregated by sex
Cumulative number of COVID-19 suspect cases tested by PCR or rapid molecular testing, disaggregated by sex
Cumulative number of COVID-19 suspect cases tested by PCR or rapid molecular testing, disaggregated by sex
Number of times MOH counters COVID-19 related misinformation and posts on its website
Strengthened laboratory capacity (measured as total capacity for quality assured tests per day)
Cumulative number of website visitors to the COVID-19 communication portal set up by the Government of Indonesia
A surveillance mechanism for community-based reporting of outbreaks and new illnesses among humans and animals is functional

target.value: Integration of different information sources to provide inputs for surveillance is functional

title.narrative: Concrete measures to support and compensate health professionals for added COVID-19 related workload and risk are implemented

baseline.value: Concrete measures to support and compensate health professionals for COVID-19 are not implemented.

target.value: Concrete measures to support and compensate health professionals for COVID-19 are implemented.

actual.value: Incentives and death compensation for health professionals in COVID-19 response is supported with MOH Decree KMK NumberHK.01.07/MENKES/392/2020

title.narrative: A surveillance mechanism for community-based reporting of outbreaks and new illnesses among humans and animals is functional
Improved reporting and surveillance system (measured as the availability of an improved surveillance system that incorporates lessons from the COVID-19 response experience)
Concrete measures to support and compensate health professionals for added COVID-19 related workload and risk are implemented
Infection prevention and clinical management protocols developed and disseminated to all non-referral facilities
